Sentencas: The ionic current-overpotential characteristics of cathodes on ceria-based electrolytes have been evaluated by galvanostatic current-interrupt measurements.
Titulo: Electrochemical characteristics of cathodes in solid oxide fuel cells based on ceria electrolytes

Sentencas: The measurements were carried out on mixed conducting ceria electrolytes under fuel cell operating conditions.
Titulo: Electrochemical characteristics of cathodes in solid oxide fuel cells based on ceria electrolytes

Sentencas: The effect on the oxygen reduction kinetics of the simultaneous transport of electrons and oxygen was investigated.
Titulo: Electrochemical characteristics of cathodes in solid oxide fuel cells based on ceria electrolytes

Sentencas: As model substances for cathodes were La0.8Sr0.2MnO3, La0.84Sr0.16CoO3, Pt, Ag, and Au.
Titulo: Electrochemical characteristics of cathodes in solid oxide fuel cells based on ceria electrolytes

Sentencas: Cathode reaction mechanisms as a function of the transport properties are discussed for the different cathode materials.
Titulo: Electrochemical characteristics of cathodes in solid oxide fuel cells based on ceria electrolytes

Sentencas: Steady-state cathode overpotentials were interpreted using a Butler-Volmer-type equation to describe charge-transfer processes and to evaluate exchange current densities.
Titulo: Electrochemical characteristics of cathodes in solid oxide fuel cells based on ceria electrolytes

Sentencas: At 700 degrees C the exchange current density of the best cathode La0.84Sr0.16CoO3 was 180 mA/cm(2) whereas the one for La0.8Sr0.3MnO3 was only 30 mA/cm(2).
Titulo: Electrochemical characteristics of cathodes in solid oxide fuel cells based on ceria electrolytes

Sentencas: In both cases we identified charge-transfer on the cathode material as the rate-limiting step.
Titulo: Electrochemical characteristics of cathodes in solid oxide fuel cells based on ceria electrolytes
